ids_info.name: camera_x_rays
ids_info.description: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems)

camera_x_rays/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “channel viewing the upper divertor”. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/frame.documentation: Set of frames. Each time step corresponds to the beginning of the photon integration of each image. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/frame/counts_n.documentation: Number of counts detected on each pixel during one exposure time. First dimension : line index (horizontal axis). Second dimension: column index (vertical axis). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within frame container: Set of frames. Each time step corresponds to the beginning of the photon integration of each image.

camera_x_rays/frame/time.documentation: Time. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within frame container: Set of frames. Each time step corresponds to the beginning of the photon integration of each image.

camera_x_rays/t_e_magnetic_axis.documentation: Electron temperature at the magnetic axis, inferred from ratios of soft x-rays emissivity at different energies. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/t_e_magnetic_axis/data.documentation: Data. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within t_e_magnetic_axis container: Electron temperature at the magnetic axis, inferred from ratios of soft x-rays emissivity at different energies.

camera_x_rays/t_e_magnetic_axis/validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within t_e_magnetic_axis container: Electron temperature at the magnetic axis, inferred from ratios of soft x-rays emissivity at different energies.

Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within t_e_magnetic_axis container: Electron temperature at the magnetic axis, inferred from ratios of soft x-rays emissivity at different energies.

camera_x_rays/t_e_magnetic_axis/time.documentation: Time. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within t_e_magnetic_axis container: Electron temperature at the magnetic axis, inferred from ratios of soft x-rays emissivity at different energies.

camera_x_rays/photon_energy.documentation: List of values of the photon energy (coordinate for quantum_effiency). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/quantum_efficiency.documentation: Quantum efficiency of the detector, i.e. conversion factor multiplying the number of counts to obtain the number of photons impacting the detector, tabulated as a function of the photon energy, for each pixel of the detector. If all pixels have the same quantum efficiency, just set the size of the first and second dimensions to 1. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/energy_threshold_lower.documentation: Lower energy detection threshold on each pixel of the detector (photons are counted only if their energy is above this value). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/energy_configuration_name.documentation: Name of the chosen energy configuration (energy detection threshold). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/pixel_status.documentation: Status of each pixel : +1 for valid pixels, -1 for inactive pixels, -2 for mis-calibrated pixels. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/aperture.documentation: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/aperture/geometry_type.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic.

camera_x_rays/aperture/centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic.

camera_x_rays/aperture/centre/r.documentation: Major radius. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

camera_x_rays/aperture/centre/phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

camera_x_rays/aperture/centre/z.documentation: Height. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

camera_x_rays/aperture/radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x1_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x1_unit_vector/x.documentation: Component along X axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

camera_x_rays/aperture/x1_unit_vector/y.documentation: Component along Y axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

camera_x_rays/aperture/x1_unit_vector/z.documentation: Component along Z axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

camera_x_rays/aperture/x2_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x2_unit_vector/x.documentation: Component along X axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within x2_unit_vector container: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x2_unit_vector/y.documentation: Component along Y axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within x2_unit_vector container: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x2_unit_vector/z.documentation: Component along Z axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within x2_unit_vector container: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x3_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x3_unit_vector/x.documentation: Component along X axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x3_unit_vector/y.documentation: Component along Y axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x3_unit_vector/z.documentation: Component along Z axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x1_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic.

camera_x_rays/aperture/x2_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic.

camera_x_rays/aperture/outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic.

camera_x_rays/aperture/outline/x1.documentation: Positions along x1 axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

camera_x_rays/aperture/outline/x2.documentation: Positions along x2 axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

camera_x_rays/aperture/surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within aperture container: Description of the collimating aperture of the diagnostic.

camera_x_rays/camera.documentation: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/camera/pixel_dimensions.documentation: Pixel dimension in each direction (x1, x2). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within camera container: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane.

camera_x_rays/camera/pixels_n.documentation: Number of pixels in each direction (x1, x2). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within camera container: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane.

camera_x_rays/camera/pixel_position.documentation: Position of the centre of each pixel. First dimension : line index (x1 axis). Second dimension: column index (x2 axis). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within camera container: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane.

camera_x_rays/camera/pixel_position/r.documentation: Major radius. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within camera container: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane. Within pixel_position container: Position of the centre of each pixel. First dimension : line index (x1 axis). Second dimension: column index (x2 axis).

camera_x_rays/camera/pixel_position/phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within camera container: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane. Within pixel_position container: Position of the centre of each pixel. First dimension : line index (x1 axis). Second dimension: column index (x2 axis).

camera_x_rays/camera/pixel_position/z.documentation: Height. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within camera container: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane. Within pixel_position container: Position of the centre of each pixel. First dimension : line index (x1 axis). Second dimension: column index (x2 axis).

camera_x_rays/camera/camera_dimensions.documentation: Total camera dimension in each direction (x1, x2). The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane.

camera_x_rays/camera/x3_unit_vector/z.documentation: Component along Z axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within camera container: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the camera plane and oriented towards the plasma.

camera_x_rays/camera/line_of_sight.documentation: Description of the line of sight for each pixel, given by 2 points. For each coordinate : first dimension : line index (x1 axis); second dimension: column index (x2 axis). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within camera container: Characteristics of the camera used. The orientation of the camera is described as follows : pixels are aligned along x1 and x2 unit vectors while x3 is normal to the detector plane.

camera_x_rays/filter_window.documentation: Characteristics of the filter window. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/filter_window/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “channel viewing the upper divertor”. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/geometry_typ.documentation: Geometry of the filter contour. Note that there is some flexibility in the choice of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3). The data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the filter, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

options.name: polygonal
options.description: Contour described by a polygonal outline in the (X1, X2) plane

options.name: circular
options.description: Circle in the (X1, X2) plane, defined by its centre and radius

options.name: rectangle
options.description: Rectangle in the (X1, X2) plane, defined by its centre and widths in the X1 and X2 directions

camera_x_rays/filter_window/geometry_typ.documentation: Short string identifier. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within geometry_type container: Geometry of the filter contour. Note that there is some flexibility in the choice of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3). The data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the filter, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below.

Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within geometry_type container: Geometry of the filter contour. Note that there is some flexibility in the choice of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3). The data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the filter, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below.

Verbose description. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within geometry_type container: Geometry of the filter contour. Note that there is some flexibility in the choice of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3). The data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the filter, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/curvature_ty.documentation: Curvature of the filter. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

options.name: cylindrical_x1
options.description: Cylindrical in the X1 direction, use x1_curvature

options.name: cylindrical_x2
options.description: Cylindrical in the X2 direction, use x2_curvature

options.name: spherical
options.description: Spherical : same curvature radius in X1 and X2 directions, indicated in x1_curvature

options.name: toroidal
options.description: Toroidal : x1_curvature in X1 direction and x2_curvature in X2 direction

camera_x_rays/filter_window/curvature_ty.documentation: Short string identifier. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within curvature_type container: Curvature of the filter.

Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within curvature_type container: Curvature of the filter.

Verbose description. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within curvature_type container: Curvature of the filter.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/centre.documentation: Coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the filter. This origin is located within the filter area and should be the middle point of the filter surface. If geometry_type=2, it's the centre of the circular filter. If geometry_type=3, it's the centre of the rectangular filter. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/centre/r.documentation: Major radius. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within centre container: Coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the filter. This origin is located within the filter area and should be the middle point of the filter surface. If geometry_type=2, it's the centre of the circular filter. If geometry_type=3, it's the centre of the rectangular filter.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/centre/phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within centre container: Coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the filter. This origin is located within the filter area and should be the middle point of the filter surface. If geometry_type=2, it's the centre of the circular filter. If geometry_type=3, it's the centre of the rectangular filter.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/centre/z.documentation: Height. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within centre container: Coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the filter. This origin is located within the filter area and should be the middle point of the filter surface. If geometry_type=2, it's the centre of the circular filter. If geometry_type=3, it's the centre of the rectangular filter.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type/index = 2. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/x1_unit_vect.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

Component along X axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

Component along Y axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

Component along Z axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

camera_x_rays/filter_window/x2_unit_vect.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

Component along X axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within x2_unit_vector container: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

Component along Y axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within x2_unit_vector container: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

Component along Z axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within x2_unit_vector container: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

The X3 axis is normal to the filter surface and oriented towards the plasma. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

The X3 axis is normal to the filter surface and oriented towards the plasma.

The X3 axis is normal to the filter surface and oriented towards the plasma.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/x1_width.documentation: Full width of the filter in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type/index = 3. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/x2_width.documentation: Full width of the filter in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type/index = 3. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the filter in the (X1, X2) coordinate system, used only if geometry_type/index=1. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/outline/x1.documentation: Positions along x1 axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the filter in the (X1, X2) coordinate system, used only if geometry_type/index=1. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/outline/x2.documentation: Positions along x2 axis. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the filter in the (X1, X2) coordinate system, used only if geometry_type/index=1. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/x1_curvature.documentation: Radius of curvature in the X1 direction, to be filled only for curvature_type/index = 2, 4 or 5. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/x2_curvature.documentation: Radius of curvature in the X2 direction, to be filled only for curvature_type/index = 3 or 5. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/surface.documentation: Surface of the filter, derived from the above geometric data. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/material.documentation: Material of the filter window. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/material/nam.documentation: Short string identifier. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within material container: Material of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/material/ind.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within material container: Material of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/material/des.documentation: Verbose description. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window. Within material container: Material of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/thickness.documentation: Thickness of the filter window. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/wavelength_l.documentation: Lower bound of the filter wavelength range. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/wavelength_u.documentation: Upper bound of the filter wavelength range. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/wavelengths.documentation: Array of wavelength values. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/filter_window/photon_absor.documentation: Probability of absorbing a photon passing through the filter as a function of its wavelength. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within filter_window container: Characteristics of the filter window.

camera_x_rays/exposure_time.documentation: Exposure time. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/readout_time.documentation: Time used to read out each frame on the detector. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/detector_humidity.documentation: Fraction of humidity (0-1) measured at the detector level. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/detector_humidity/data.documentation: Data. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within detector_humidity container: Fraction of humidity (0-1) measured at the detector level.

camera_x_rays/detector_humidity/time.documentation: Time. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within detector_humidity container: Fraction of humidity (0-1) measured at the detector level.

camera_x_rays/detector_temperature.documentation: Temperature measured at the detector level. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).

camera_x_rays/detector_temperature/data.documentation: Data. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within detector_temperature container: Temperature measured at the detector level.

camera_x_rays/detector_temperature/time.documentation: Time. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems). Within detector_temperature container: Temperature measured at the detector level.

camera_x_rays/time.documentation: Generic time. Within camera_x_rays IDS: X-rays imaging camera (can be used for soft or hard X-rays imaging systems).
